subject: Exceptions in Perl?
header: I borrowed the title from Curtis recently shared gist. I am sure everyone of us have dealt with exceptions in Perl. Being a CPAN fan, I found plenty of choices readily available. I am a big fan of Try::Tiny and has been my first choice always to deal with exceptions in Perl. I suggest you must check out the gist for more insights and suggestions shared by Curtis.

I would also like to share another gem by Curtis, i.e. Porting from Moose or Moo. It is a big help for anyone to move to Corinna from Moose or Moo. Most of my personal work shared on MetaCPAN used Moo. The document by Curtis would be handy when porting to Corinna once it is part of core Perl. I am eagerly waiting for it to happen.

Finally, this is my 99th edition of the weekly newsletter. In two weeks time, I would be presenting the 100th edition. I joined the team of editors in May 2018, thanks to the chief editor, Gabor Szabo, for all the support and guidance.
Enjoy rest of the newsletter and pray for the world peace.

entries.title: I start to write the book "Perl for Beginners to Mastering Perl in a week"
entries.author: yuki_kimoto
entries.text: An honest attempt by Yuki to write Perl book. Please do spread the news.

chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Fortunate Numbers" and "Pisano Period". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 155

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Missing Permutation" and "Padovan Prime" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 154

entries.author: colin_crain
entries.text: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.
entries.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 150

entries.author: adam_russell
entries.text: Loved the use of handy CPAN modules like Algorithm::Loops and Math::Primality. Thanks for sharing new ideas.
entries.title: Padovan Prime Directive: Find the Missing Permutations

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Arne always shares multiple solutions of each task, showing different aspects. I liked the Perl and Raku comparison most. Thanks for sharing your knowledge with us.
entries.title: Padovan is Missing with Raku and Perl

entries.author: bruce_gray
entries.text: Thanks Bruce for the bonus this week. The quality blog content has Perl, Raku and Python. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: TWC Episode 154 - Padawan Missing

entries.author: colin_crain
entries.text: The best of the blog, is the approach to solve the task. It is like solving the puzzle by putting all the pieces one by one. Masterpiece.
entries.title: Who Took My Cheese?

entries.author: colin_crain
entries.text: Colin always surpised us with amazing stuff in his blog. You really don't want to miss it. Incredible, keep it up great work.
entries.title: Padovans Dog

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Dave style of blogging is also very interesting and catchy. I liked how Dave plays with the week number. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: A Quick One While I Do Other Things: Weekly Challenge #154

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: The best part is home grown solution for permutation in Perl. Cool attempt. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: PWC154 - Missing Permutation

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: I liked the order of solution, Perl first then Raku. It gives better comparison how Raku behaves. Thank you for your effort.
entries.title: PWC154 - Padovan Prime

entries.author: james_smith
entries.text: James is not afraid of using bit operator. It makes code compact, very clever. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge #154 - do and redo there is no try!

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Lots of Raku magic in this week blog as usual. If you are new to Raku then this is the good start for you. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 154: Missing Permutations and Padovan Primes

entries.author: luca_ferrari
entries.text: Luca showing off one-liner in Raku. Amazing power of Raku. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 154: lazyness and recursion

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: Luis is known for his one-liner in Perl using CPAN module. The end result is short and compact. Well done.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 154

entries.author: peter_campbell_smith
entries.text: Short and precise blog to cover up the details of working. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Perming Perl plus Padovan primes

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: The best hack to find the missing. Prepare the possible list and delete item from the input list to find the missing. No gimmicks. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge 154: Missing Padovan

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
